fields.summary: Volume detail page does not show volume status if volume creation fails.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Failed and deleted volumes display links to the volume detail page and the manage snapshots page on the page and in the menu items.  The link to a deleted volume's detail page will return a 404 (since the volume no longer exists).

Screenshot attached.

In summary, changes for this ticket should be (updated by J.Lo):
* Remove Deleted volumes from landing page
* Remove facet for deleted volumes from MSB
* Disable menu options for volumes in the "deleting" state from landing page
* Remove Add Snaps tile and actions (except delete) from Failed volume details page, add some text that says "You cannot create new snapshots from a failed volume."
fields.summary: Deleted and failed volumes don't display proper links and action menu items on volumes landing page

comments.body:
[~kgill], deleted volumes are useless, we've been cleaning up the landing page for deleted resources that cannot be acted on with other tickets. Part of this should be to remove deleted volumes from the view, and from the MSB facet as well. [~dkavanagh] can give tips on how he did this in another ticket recently. 

Failed volumes should stick around until deleted (seeing those is useful), and the menu options should be disabled for volumes in the "deleting" state. 

Text regarding the inability to snap a failed volume is OK, I'll review the content when it gets to UX review. The snaps taken before the volume failed should still be viable, though (and this is when the user needs them most), and so we should not get rid of the Manage Snapshots link to show them in that case. 


In summary, changes for this ticket *should* be:
* Remove Deleted volumes from landing page
* Remove facet for deleted volumes from MSB
* Disable menu options for volumes in the "deleting" state from landing page 
* Remove Add Snaps tile and actions (except delete) from Failed volume details page, add some text that says "You cannot create new snapshots from a failed volume."

PR#1498 removes the facet and filters out deleted stacks. I may have tried filtering in the API call, but that's not an option for DescribeStacks, so I filtered by simply excluding those stacks from the list like this:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/GUI-1900/eucaconsole/views/stacks.py#L131-L132

[~kgill] it's much more likely that people will not expect to see a deleted volume in their list. It's white noise, and clutter. It's much more common for something you delete to go away. Let's filter them out, please.

[~jloza]: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1507 updated to filter out volumes, allow failed volumes to be deleted from the landing page or detail page, and hide menu items for volumes in a 'deleting' state.  

[~ccassler]: Just a heads up that I had to update the selenium tests since they assumed deleted volumes would stick around on the landing page.  I switched the VolumeView.verify_volume_status_is_deleted() method to use tester.wait_for_element_not_present_by_css() instead of tester.wait_for_text_present_by_xpath().  Hopefully that works, but if it doesn't I may need your help to get the Jenkins build to pass.
[~jloza], I merged the PR which included another fix. Sorry about that. Kamal can always do any tweaks on a new branch/PR
[~kgill] or [~ccassler], I need to see a failed volume to verify UX changes for this ticket. Anybody got one?

Great job, [~kgill]!

Ux review passed, ready for code review.

[~ccassler] when you verify this ticket, please make sure to test a case where a volume has existing snaps on it **before** it fails...you should still be able to see and interact with those snaps, you just can't create new ones.

[~jloza]: AFAICT, it is impossible to create snapshots for a failed volume at any point in its history, since the volume's failed state is only reachable when attempting to create a volume.  Meaning, a volume will never move from an available or attached state to a failed state -- It can only move from a creating state to a failed state when it fails.
[~kgill] this is interesting and unexpected. What happens to a volume when the underlying hardware dies?
[~jloza]: Good question, I'm not sure what the volume state would be if the underlying hardware dies, although Boto hints at an 'error' status for that case.  Perhaps [~zhill] would know?

Yes, "failed" volumes only become that way if they fail to be created. There is no state transition from "available" or "in-use" to "failed", only from "creating"->"failed". AWS has the idea of "error" for volumes but we do not (yet). The "error" state has a bunch of other sub-states and implications (like blocked IO so you can't use it). We'll probably add support for that in the fairly near future, but just assume that "error" has no follow-up actions for the time being.

Verified.  I was not able to create snapshots from failed volumes, deleted volume links were disabled, delete volumes were removed from landing page, and I could not access the menu option from volumes in 'deleting' state.
